snippet: House Republicans said that Mitt Romney could go his own way on smaller issues if elected, but that he must understand they are driving the party’s policy agenda.
abstract: Mitt Romney and House Republicans diverge on some legislative issues, and Republican lawmakers have said that they will tolerate differences on more minor issues as long as Romney understands that they are driving the party's policy agenda; Romney's campaign has set up meetings with House members in order to ensure that the party acts in lock-step to defeat Pres Obama.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

lead_paragraph: House Republicans said that Mitt Romney could go his own way on smaller issues if elected, but that he must understand they are driving the party’s policy agenda.

headline.seo: House Republicans Would Thwart Romney Move to Center
headline.main: G.O.P. Lawmakers and Romney Face a Delicate Tango
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Lawmakers And Romney Face A Delicate Tango
